revised_title: Discovery of the Medullary Canal in Quadrupeds
tldr: The author, William Sewell, describes the discovery of a canal in the medulla spinalis of various quadrupeds, such as horses, bullocks, sheep, hogs, and dogs. This canal connects the extremity of the sixth ventricle of the brain to the center of the spinal marrow and is lined by a membrane resembling the tunica arachnoidea.
